title: Asian Art Council: Collection Focus—Collecting Legacies at the Art Institute
short_description: Patron members of the Asian Art Council are invited to join curators for a Collection Focus program featuring the intimate demonstration of objects.
header_description: Asian Art Council: Collection Focus—Collecting Legacies at the Art Institute
list_description: Patron members of the Asian Art Council are invited to join curators for a Collection Focus program featuring the intimate demonstration of objects.
description:
Join curators from the Department of Asian Art for an examination of rare objects from across Asia followed by a reception in the Nichols Board of Trustees Suite.

The museum’s Asian art collection has benefited immeasurably from the generous gifts of collectors whose interests span regions, time periods, and genres. This intimate event focuses on objects given by Marilynn and James Alsdorf spanning regions from Iran to Japan. Featured artworks include Ganesha and His Consorts, Tabout 1800. Enjoy a rare opportunity to view this work and others outside of a gallery setting, and stay for drinks and light bites with the curators.

Learn more about the Asian Art Council.
buy_button_caption: This program is exclusive to Gold, Silver and Bronze members of the Asian Art Council.
